descriptions.description: Developer turnover reduces the core developer stock as experienced members leave the project.
The skill up flow increases the new contributor stock by transitioning individuals from the onboarding pool.
The skill up flow increases the experienced contributor stock by advancing proficient new contributors.
The promotion rate flow increases the experienced contributor stock by advancing capable new contributors.
The promotion rate flow increases the core developer stock by promoting experienced contributors who demonstrate commitment.
Effective mentorship accelerates skill development by providing personalized guidance and tacit knowledge.
Effective mentorship increases promotion rates by preparing contributors for more advanced project roles.
More core developers increase mentorship capacity and implicit knowledge transfer opportunities.
Quality documentation accelerates skill development by providing accessible learning resources for newcomers.
A larger pool of potential contributors increases the new contributor stock through successful onboarding.
More new contributors increase the skill up flow as more individuals undergo training and onboarding.
More core developers can increase turnover flow due to burnout or new career opportunities.
More experienced contributors increase the promotion rate flow by providing a larger pool of candidates for core roles.
